alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 03 at 3:32PM MDT until April 04 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 7 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 254... ...RED FLAG WARNING IS CANCELLED FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 254... The National Weather Service in Goodland has cancelled the Red Flag Warning that was in effect for today, Monday. The Red Flag Warning continues for tomorrow, Tuesday. The following conditions are expected tomorrow. * Affected Area...In Colorado, Fire Weather Zone 254 Cheyenne. * Winds...South 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 14 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are imminent. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
